1:
Issachar's four sons were Tola, Puah, Jashub, and Shimron.
\li1
2:
Tola's sons were Uzzi, Rephaiah, Jeriel, Jahmai, Ibsam, and Samuel. They were all leaders of the clans descended from them.
\li2 In the record of Tola's descendants were the names of 22,600 men who were able to be in the army during the time that David was the king of Israel.
\li1
3:
Uzzi's son was Izrahiah. Izrahiah's five sons were Michael, Obadiah, Joel, and Isshiah. Izrahiah and his sons were all leaders of their clans.
\li2
4:
In the record of Izrahiah's descendants were the names of thirty-six thousand men who were able to be in the army because they had many wives and children.
\li1
5:
In the records of the clans descended from Issachar were the names of eighty-seven thousand men able to be in the army.
\s2 The descendants of Benjamin
\li2
6:
The three sons of Benjamin were Bela, Beker, and Jediael.
\li1
7:
Bela's five sons were Ezbon, Uzzi, Uzziel, Jerimoth, and Iri. They were all leaders of clans.
\li2 In the records of the clans descended from Bela there were names of 22,034 men who were able to be in the army.
\li2
8:
Beker's sons were Zemirah, Joash, Eliezer, Elioenai, Omri, Jeremoth, Abijah, Anathoth, and Alemeth.
\li2
9:
In the records of the clans descended from Beker were the names of 20,200 men and leaders of the clans who were able to be in the army.
\li1
10:
Jediael's son was Bilhan. Bilhan's sons were Jeush, Benjamin, Ehud, Kenaanah, Zethan, Tarshish, and Ahishahar.
\li1
11:
They were all leaders of clans descended from them.
\li2 There were 17,200 of them who were able to be in the army.
\li1
12:
Shuppim and Huppim were also members of this clan.
\li1 One of the descendants of Dan was Hushim.
\s2 Naphtali's sons
\li1
13:
Naphtali's sons were Jahziel, Guni, Jezer, and Shillem. They were all descendants of Jacob's slave wife Bilhah.
\s2 Manasseh's descendants
\li1
14:
This is a list of Manasseh's descendants. Manasseh had a slave wife who was from Aram. She was the mother of Asriel and Makir.
\li1 Makir was the father of Gilead.
\li2
15:
Makir had two wives. They were from the clans of Huppim and Shuppim.
\li2 One of Makir's wives was named Maacah.
\li2 Makir had another son whose name was Zelophehad. Zelophehad had no sons; he had only daughters.
\li2
16:
Makir's wife Maacah gave birth to two sons whom she named Peresh and Sheresh. Sheresh's sons were Ulam and Rakem.
\li2
17:
Ulam's son was Bedan.
\li1 Those were descendants of Gilead son of Makir and grandson of Manasseh.
\li1
18:
Makir's sister was Hammoleketh, who was the mother of Ishdod, Abi Ezer, and Mahlah.
\li1
19:
Another son of Gilead was Shemida, whose sons were Ahian, Shechem, Likhi, and Aniam.
\s2 Descendants of Ephraim
\li1
20:
This is a list of the descendants of Ephraim.
\li2 One son of Ephraim was Shuthelah.
\li2 Shuthelah's son was Bered.
\li2 Bered's son was Tahath.
\li2 Tahath's son was Eleadah.
\li2 Eleadah's son was also named Tahath.
\li2
21:
Tahath's son was Zabad.
\li2 Zabad's son was Shuthelah.
\li1 Ephraim's other sons, Ezer and Elead, went to the city of Gath to steal some cows and sheep. But they were both killed by some of the men from that city.
22:
Their father Ephraim cried for them for many days, and his family came to comfort him.
\li1
23: Then he and his wife slept together again; she became pregnant and gave birth to a son. Ephraim named him Beriah which resembles the word 'trouble' because of the trouble that his family had experienced.
24:
Ephraim's daughter was Sheerah. Her workers built three towns: Lower Beth Horon, Upper Beth Horon, and Uzzen Sheerah.
\li1
25:
Another son of Ephraim was Rephah.
\li2 Rephah's son was Resheph.
\li2 Resheph's son was Telah.
\li2 Telah's son was Tahan.
\li2
26:
Tahan's son was Ladan.
\li2 Ladan's son was Ammihud.
\li2 Ammihud's son was Elishama.
\li2
27:
Elishama's son was Nun.
\li2 Nun's son was Joshua, the man who led the Israelites after Moses died.
29:
Along the border of the area where the descendants of Manasseh lived were these towns: Beth Shan, Taanach, Megiddo, and Dor, and the nearby villages.
\m The people who lived in all those places were descendants of Jacob's son Joseph.
\s2 The descendants of Asher
\li1
30:
Asher's sons were Imnah, Ishvah, Ishvi, and Beriah. Their sister was Serah.
\li1
31:
Beriah's sons were Heber and Malkiel.
\li2 Malkiel was the father of Birzaith
\li2
32:
Heber was the father of Japhlet, Shomer, and Hotham. Their sister was Shua.
\li1
33:
Japhlet's sons were Pasach, Bimhal, and Ashvath.
\li1
34:
Japhlet's younger brother was Shomer. Shomer's sons were Rohgah, Hubbah, and Aram.
\li1
35:
Shomer's younger brother was Hotham . Hotham's sons were Zophah, Imna, Shelesh, and Amal.
\li2
36: Zophah's sons were Suah, Harnepher, Shual, Beri, Imrah,
37:
Bezer, Hod, Shamma, Shilshah, Ithran whose other name was Jether, and Beera.
\li2
39: Another descendant of Asher was Ulla, whose sons were Arah, Hanniel, and Rizia.
40: All those men were descendants of Asher, and they were all leaders of their clans. They were brave warriors and excellent leaders. In the record of the clans that are descended from Asher are the names of twenty-six thousand men who were able to be in the army.
